wikipedia_page.main: John Charlton (1849–1917) was an English painter and illustrator of historical and especially battle scenes, mainly from contemporary history.

response: * Jack Charlton (John Charlton, born 1935), British footballer
* John Charlton (artist) (1849–1917), English painter and illustrator
* John Charlton (historian) (born 1938), British historian working in the Marxist tradition
* John Charlton (MP), Member of Parliament (MP) for Malmesbury
* John Charlton (jockey) (1829-1862), English Derby winning jockey
* John Charlton Fisher (1794–1849), Canadian author and journalist

Some famous names occasionally wrote for the magazine (such as Arthur Conan Doyle, Henry Morton Stanley, Douglas Reeman etc.), and it was copiously illustrated with photographs, as well as black and white drawings by such artists as Terence Cuneo, Cecil Stuart Tresilian, Alfred Pearse, Chas Sheldon, Paul Hardy, William Barnes Wollen, John L. Wimbush, Charles J. Staniland, Joseph Finnemore, John Charlton, Warwick Goble, Tom Browne, Ernest Prater, Gordon Browne, Edward S. Hodgson, Norman H. Hardy, Inglis Sheldon Williams, and Harry Rountree.See Volumes 3 and 7, for example (bibliography).

Grove also wrote or contributed to serial installments on military history, including Types of the British Army which ran as a column on regiments in The Graphic. The Graphic also produced coloured illustrations as supplements in a series called Types of the British Army and Navy. The illustrations were usually of particular regiments such as the 10th and 19th Hussars by John Charlton, but sometimes were of particular roles, such as A Captain of the Main-Top by W Christian Symonds.
